page.title: 06THE PUB AT RODINGTON.
page.content: THE BULLS HEAD IS BUILT ON THE CORNER OF THE MAIN CROSSROADS IN RODINGTON. THIS CROSSROADS IS CALLED "THE BULL RING" AND BULL BAITING USED TO TAKE PLACE THERE.THIS IS HOW THE PUBLIC HOUSE GOT ITS NAME. THE BULLS HEAD WAS ALSO THE RESORT OF COCK FIGHTING MINERS FROM KETLEY AND OAKENGATES. THE PUB IS AN OLD BUILDIING. THE OUTSIDE DOORS ARE A DARK REDDISH BROWN. THE WALLS HAVE BEEN PAINTED A CREAMY WHITE EXCEPT FOR 2 FEET FROM THE GROUND WHICH IS PAINTED BLACK. AT THE BACK AND SIDE OF THE THE BUILDING THERE ARE SOME BLACK BEAMS. THIS IS PART OF THE ORIGINAL BUILDING WHICH IS THE SECOND OLDEST IN RODINGTON. THERE IS A SIGN WITH A PICTURE OF A BULL HANGING OVER THE MAIN ENTRANCE. THERE IS A LARGE CAR PARK AT THE SIDE OF THE PUB.
